title: Button (China), 19th century
medium: glass beads, kingfisher feathers, brass and wood [?]
provenance: button was given by Mr. Bernheim to Mary S. M. Gibson, who kept one, and turned four over to the Museum - these are, therefore, the gift of Mary S. M. Gibson.
creditline: Gift of Mary S. M. Gibson
description:
globular button; glass beads in coral, green and yellow forming a pattern on white ground over a wooden [?] mold; above and below, are ornaments of blue kingfisher feathers set in brass; the one above the globe forms a hook by which the button may be attached - buttons are mounted on cardboard covered with blue silk. Also see: 1945-54-30-b/d, which is deaccessioned.

On card 26

tombstone.epitaph:
Button (China), 19th century. glass beads, kingfisher feathers, brass and wood [?]. 
Gift of Mary S. M. Gibson. 1945-54-30-a
